things-to-do.name: CN Tower
things-to-do.description: One of Toronto's finest landmarks. 553.3 metres high, the CN Tower features a beautiful views of the city, a glass floor and revolving restaurant with delicious food.
things-to-do.address: 301 Front St W, Toronto, ON M5V 2T6, Canada

things-to-do.name: Ripley's Aquarium of Canada
things-to-do.description: Opened in 2013, this modern Toronto aquarium has many species & habitats on display. Throughout the year, they host events(such as Halloween night) that keeps things interesting whenever you decide to visit!
things-to-do.address: 288 Bremner Blvd, Toronto, ON M5V 3L9, Canada

things-to-do.name: Toronto Eaton Centre
things-to-do.description: If you need a place to shop, look no further, this is the right place. North America 's busiest mall has got a variety of shops and restaurants that is sure to please anybody.
things-to-do.address: 220 Yonge St, Toronto, ON M5B 2H1, Canada

restaurants.name: Carisma Restaurant
restaurants.address: 73 King St E, Toronto, ON M5C 1G3, Canada
restaurants.review: Impeccable, hands-on service, as warm as a goose-down duvet.

restaurants.name: Alo Restaurant
restaurants.address: 163 Spadina Ave, Toronto, ON M5V 2L6, Canada
restaurants.review: Toronto's best restaurant and bar under one roof

emergency.description: For any immediate emergencies, call 911. Check the Toronto Emergency Services for more information.

things-to-do.name: London Eye
things-to-do.description: Built in 1998 and standing at 135 metres, the London Eye is an iconic giant Ferris Wheel on the South Bank of River Thames which will provide visitors with priviledged views of the city.

things-to-do.name: Big Ben
things-to-do.description: When one thinks of the UK it is impossible to not think of the Big Ben; a 16-storey Gothic clocktower and a true national symbol.

things-to-do.name: Buckingham Palace
things-to-do.description: The residence and headquarter's of the monarch's of the United Kingdom. Visitors may visit the palace or watch the changing of the guard.

restaurants.name: The Ledbury
restaurants.review: Not only is The Ledbury the 14th best restaurant in the world, it has been voted the UK's best restaurant more than half a dozen times and holds two Michelin stars.

restaurants.name: Tangia
restaurants.review: Love the ambience of the place. Reminds me of my holiday in Morocco.

emergency.description: For any immediate emergencies, call 112 or 999.

things-to-do.name: Golden Gate Bridge
things-to-do.description: Unfortunately known as the second most used suicide site in the world, the Golden Gate Bridge is a beautiful piece of engineering connecting the San Francisco Bay and the Pacific Ocean.
things-to-do.address: Golden Gate Bridge, San Francisco, CA, USA

things-to-do.name: Pier 39
things-to-do.description: A popular touristic attraction and shopping centre with scenic views, sea-lion sightings, eateries, shops & entertainment.
things-to-do.address: Beach St & The Embarcadero, San Francisco, CA 94133, USA

things-to-do.name: Coit Tower
things-to-do.description: Also known as Lilian Coit Memorial Tower, is a 64 metre tower built in the 1930's known for its 360-degree views.
things-to-do.address: 1 Telegraph Hill Blvd, San Francisco, CA 94133, USA

restaurants.name: La Taqueria
restaurants.address: 2889 Mission St, San Francisco, CA 94110, USA
restaurants.review: One of the best Mission-style burrito joints.

restaurants.name: Gary Danko
restaurants.address: 800 North Point St, San Francisco, CA 94109, USA
restaurants.review: An oasis of excellence that never loses its luster

emergency.description: For any immediate emergencies, call 911. Check the Department of Emergency Management for more information.

things-to-do.name: Sydney Opera House
things-to-do.description: One of the 20th century's most distinctive buildings, the Sydney Opera House is a landmark art centre for the performing arts, such as opera, theatre, music and dance.

things-to-do.name: Sydney Harbour Bridge
things-to-do.description: Iconic steel arch bridge built in 1932, connecting Sydney Central and North Shore. Offers a bridge climb experience.
things-to-do.address: Sydney Harbour Bridge, Sydney NSW, Australia

things-to-do.name: Taronga Zoo
things-to-do.description: Officially opened on 7 October 1916, the Taronga Zoo is the city zoo of Sydney with over 340 separate animal species and a ferry service to the city centre.
things-to-do.address: Bradleys Head Rd, Mosman NSW 2088, Australia

restaurants.name: Mamak
restaurants.review: A big thumbs up for Mamak. I can understand why it's so popular and enthusiastically recommended by Sydneysiders. The food is quite cheap and utterly delicious.

restaurants.name: Mr. Wong
restaurants.review: The real pleasure at Mr Wong is in seeing familiar dishes done right, elevated to levels seldom seen in Australia.

emergency.description: For any immediate emergencies, call 000. Check Australian Government Emergency Services for more information.
